Strategy Execution, Accelerated.

Do you have a strategy for growth, but the business is struggling to execute? I help leaders like you solve the big problems that are getting in the way. Problems that impede growth, mute performance, and diminish results. Ready to build the capabilities you need to deliver the results you want?

Let's talk

The MCG Way

Start with the outcome you want and execute with the discipline you need.

The goal is simple: help you better execute your strategy, improve performance, and deliver strong results. MCG digs in to identify the barriers to strategy execution and build a plan to achieve breakthrough performance.

The means by which we reach the goal is the MCG Way - an integration of Core Values, Process, and Approach proven to create value, improve performance and deliver stronger results. The MCG Way delivers.

MCG Core Values

  1. Never ask for trust, earn it. Do not lean on bold promises or the glory of past performance. Focus on the value at large and get to work.
  2. Act like an owner. Be a steward of the clientâ€™s businesses by creating value greater than the cost of working together. Behave like a partner without equity.
  3. Relentlessly reinvent. Commit to lifelong learning and a growth-mindset. You cannot help clients reinvent their businesses if you do not invest in and challenge yourself.
  4. Invest in relationships. Openly share ideas and perspectives that generate ideas and creativity. Monetizing every interaction narrows the scope of partnership and myopia starves value creation.
  5. Be willing to lose the business. Provide an honest, candid, and constructive external perspective, even when it creates discomfort or resistance. Be willing to pay a high cost of candor.

MCG Process

  1. Start with where you are. Apply a proven discovery process to understand where you are today, where you want to go, what is working, and where efforts are stalling.
  2. Validate and articulate the problem to be solved. With a clear picture of the current state, revisit the problem to be solved to get clear on the outcome you want, and the value realized when you get there.
  3. Design the solution and path forward. Partner in designing the capabilities you need to execute your strategy, and develop a pragmatic, action-oriented roadmap to get the business moving.
  4. Ready the business for change. While not required in every engagement, larger scale changes and transformations benefit greatly from conducting business readiness activities prior to launch.
  5. Make it happen. Align the organization, launch the solution, and execute the plan including management of risks, monitoring of pace and milestones, and measurement of value created.

MCG Approach

  1. Begin with the end in mind. Start with the outcomes you want and the value they create, then create the map to help you get there.
  2. Process first, always. Outcomes should drive process design. And process design determines the structure, technology, systems, people, and skills you need â€” not the other way around.
  3. Appreciate the system. In business and organizations, nothing exists or operates in a vacuum. Fix systemic issues before chasing symptoms.
  4. Rigor without rigidity. Strike the balance and unlock your potential to execute without suffocating your ability to innovate.
  5. Top shelf, not off the shelf. Create bespoke strategies that leverage leading practices and battle-tested experience while adapting them to the unique needs and goals of your organization.

Who MCG Helps

MCG works with senior leaders, executives, and ownership small- and middle-market businesses across several industries including, but not limited to:
  • Agri-Business (Grain Handling & Processing)
  • Animal Feed Production
  • Food Production & Processing
  • Light Industrial Manufacturing
  • Component and Original Equipment Manufacturing
Successful clients are those share MCGâ€™s values and exhibit the following characteristics:
  • They have the learning and strategic agility to try new ways of working.
  • They have an adaptive organizational culture and demonstrated appetite for change.
  • They have their sights set on growth and are willing to invest in capabilities to fuel it.
  • They have decision rights and are willing to use them.
  • They have a bias for action and are willing to take calculated risks.
  • They have the confidence to trust the process: build pragmatically, apply rigorously, and challenge productively.

Meet Joe

The Mosher Consulting Group is my commitment to supporting the sustainable growth and success of this sector of the economy.

Joe Mosher

Over more than two decades, I have had the good fortune to build a challenging and diversified career with experiences in management consulting, plant oprations, process improvement, internal process control auditing, global risk and assurance leadership, and driving large-scale change. These opportunities included serving in both individual contributor and management roles of large multi-site and globally distributed teams. Most recently from 2008 to 2021, I held senior roles at Cargill, Inc., a privately held firm serving food, agriculture, financial, and industrial customers with more than 1,200 facilities across nearly 70 countries. I hold a bachelorâ€™s in political science specializing in economic development, and a masterâ€™s in organization development, from the University of Minnesota, Twin Cities.

I founded Mosher Consulting Group on the operating thesis that extending access to strategy execution advisory services beyond large firms and multinationals addresses an unmet need in the market. Small- and middle-market businesses are essential to a growing and prosperous U.S. economy, yet they disproportionately suffer from economic slowdowns and downturns.
